com.neovisionaries.android.oauth20

Class AuthorizationRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.neovisionaries.android.oauth20.AuthorizationRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable

    public class AuthorizationRequest
extends Object
implements android.os.Parcelable
    OAuth 2.0 authorization request.
    Since:
    1.9
    Author:
    Takahiko Kawasaki
    See Also:
    RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.1. Authorization Endpoint, RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 4.1.1. Authorization Request, RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 4.2.1. Authorization Request

        Set the authorization endpoint.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - The authorization endpoint.
        Returns:
        this object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The endpoint includes a fragment component. It is prohibited by the specification.
        See Also:
        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.1. Authorization Endpoint

        this object.

      • getRedirectUri

        public URL getRedirectUri()
        Get the redirect URI (= the value of redirect_uri parameter (OPTIONAL parameter)).
        Returns:
        The redirect URI.
        See Also:
        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.1.2. Redirection Endpoint

      • setRedirectUri

        public AuthorizationRequest setRedirectUri(URL redirectUri)
        Set the redirect URI (= the value of redirect_uri parameter (OPTIONAL parameter)).

        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.1.2. Redirection Endpoint says "The redirection endpoint URI MUST be an absolute URI", so this method accepts the parameter value as URL.

        Parameters:
        redirectUri - The redirect URI.
        Returns:
        this object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The redirect URI failed to be converted into a URL, or it includes a fragment component.
        See Also:
        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.1.2. Redirection Endpoint

      • setRedirectUri

        public AuthorizationRequest setRedirectUri(String redirectUri)
        Set the redirect URI (= the value of redirect_uri parameter (OPTIONAL parameter)).

        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.1.2. Redirection Endpoint says "The redirection endpoint URI MUST be an absolute URI".

        Parameters:
        redirectUri - The redirect URI.
        Returns:
        this object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The redirect URI includes a fragment component. It is prohibited by the specification.
        Since:
        1.10
        See Also:
        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.1.2. Redirection Endpoint

      • getScopeSet

        public Set<String> getScopeSet()
        Get the scopes, which are elements in the value of scope parameter (OPTIONAL parameter).
        Returns:
        The scopes.

      • setScopeSet

        public AuthorizationRequest setScopeSet(Set<String> scopeSet)
        Set the scopes, which are elements in the value of scope parameter (OPTIONAL parameter).

        Scopes must comply with the specification shown below. Otherwise, IllegalArgumentException is thrown. 

         scope-token = 1*( %x21 / %x23-5B / %x5D-7E )

        null and an empty value do not raise IllegalArgumentException and are just ignored.

        Parameters:
        scopeSet - Scopes to be set.
        Returns:
        this object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - There is a scope which does not comply with the specification.
        See Also:
        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.3. Access Token Scope

      • addScopes

        public AuthorizationRequest addScopes(String... scopes)
        Add scopes, which are elements in the value of scope parameter (OPTIONAL parameter).

        Scopes must comply with the specification shown below. Otherwise, IllegalArgumentException is thrown. 

         scope-token = 1*( %x21 / %x23-5B / %x5D-7E )

        null and an empty value do not raise IllegalArgumentException and are just ignored.

        Parameters:
        scopes - Scopes to be added.
        Returns:
        this object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - There is a scope which does not comply with the specification.
        See Also:
        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.3. Access Token Scope

      • removeScopes

        public AuthorizationRequest removeScopes(String... scopes)
        Remove scopes, which are elements in the value of scope parameter (OPTIONAL parameter).
        Parameters:
        scopes - Scopes to be removed.
        Returns:
        this object.
        See Also:
        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.3. Access Token Scope

      • addParameter

        public AuthorizationRequest addParameter(String name,
                                         String value)
        Add an extra parameter to the authorization request. For example, ("display", "touch") for Facebook.
        Parameters:
        name - Parameter name.
        value - Parameter value.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • removeParameter

        public AuthorizationRequest removeParameter(String name)
        Remove an extra parameter from the authorization request.
        Parameters:
        name - Parameter name.
        Returns:
        this object.

      • getScopeDelimiter

        public char getScopeDelimiter()
        Get the delimiter for scopes. The default value is a space (0x20).
        Returns:
        The scope delimiter.

      • setScopeDelimiter

        public AuthorizationRequest setScopeDelimiter(char delimiter)
        Set the delimiter for scopes.

        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.3. Access Token Scope says "The value of the scope parameter is expressed as a list of space-delimited, case-sensitive strings." However, Facebook does not comply with this specification and uses a comma (0x2C) as the delimiter. Therefore, for Facebook, setScopeDelimiter(',') needs to be called.

        Parameters:
        delimiter - The scope
        Returns:
        this object.
        See Also:
        RFC 6749 (OAuth 2.0), 3.3. Access Token Scope

      • toURL

        public URL toURL()
        Convert this authorization request to a URL.
        Returns:
        The URL that represents this authorization request.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException -
        • Endpoint is not set.
        • Response type is not set.
        • Client ID is not set.
